channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Raised pavement and uneven surface, 18th November
item.description:
This is located down an alley that is a walk way for people between Clyde Rd brockworth and Trent Rd brockworth tree roots coming up through ground and very rough pavement which is very unsafe for pedestrian especially disabled people.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clyde Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Red traffic light out, 17th November
item.description:

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 17th November
item.description:
Hi Recently tarmac work has been done on Bouncers Lane, and ever since the man hole cover outside the boundary wall of Steyne House has become loose and very noisy when cars drive over it. Please could someone look at it? Many Thanks.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 17th November
item.description:
The Diversion sign is still there this morning at the junction of Porchester Rd / Hucclecote Rd as originally stated. See photo. I'm not sure how it can be missed.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 17th November
item.description:
email rec 16/11/2023 I have received your letter referring to the essential work to be carried out on Copt Elm Road on the 30th nov. I live at Fritwell, with my house entrance in Grovelands Close, and I would be grateful if you could arrange for the entrance road to Grovelands to also be cleaned . I have been doing it every year as there are two drains there. However, I am finding the work too heavy for me as I am getting on just a bit!!! Wet leaves weigh such a lot! Many thanks in anticipation.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 17th November
item.description:
manhole cover in the middle of the road lose making noise and this is also tarmac around it is sinking,about an 1"
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 17th November
item.description:
The pavement outside 55 bouncers lane becomes impassable due to a large puddle that extends from the road. When walking with children to or from school they either get wet or have to go into the busy road to avoid it.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Northside of the road after traffic lights, 17th November
item.description:
The road is in extremely poor condition over and past the pedestrian crossing driving towards the north. This has been in an awful situation for years now and nothing is being done to resolve. This part of the road is causing damage to all that drive over it because it's unavoidable. It is also really unsafe for cyclists and motorbikes as the road ridges run vertically with the road and the tires get caught and cause massive balance issues to those riding. This needs a small area of new tarmac to resolve.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Many large holes have reoccurred due to weather and continuous traffic, 17th November
item.description:
There are around 6 very large potholes that have reopened after poor patchwork previously. The weather will continue to make more worse and the road section will be un-driveable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 311, Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree shoots blocking footpath, 17th November
item.description:
Lower shoots from a mature tree are blocking pedestrian access along footpath. On Colesbourn Road at the junction with Robert Burns Avenue. Near to 9 Robert Burns Avenue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Colesbourne Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
